ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: good if you want to spend some quality time in the lab. wouldn't do if you don't enjoy the lab as much.

20 hours of independent research per week along with a proposal, presentation, and mock grant report. This course largely depends on your lab and your mentor. If you like research, you should definitely choose this option.

The time commitment is no joke and highly recommend that you find a good lab with a nice mentor truly willing to mentor you. Helps if there's an established project with some direction so that not just doing lab tech-y "research"
Excellent chance to pursue independent academic research with a faculty mentor in the lab - be prepared to work hard!
